Message.Text: Hey Tommy, I’m really trying to wrap my head around why you’re so set on using SQL for our next project.
I just think SQL makes sense! But I’m curious why you believe NoSQL is the better choice. Can you clarify?
Well, NoSQL seems to be more adaptable for our data needs, but I can’t help but wonder if it’s really that straightforward.
Adaptability is great, but does that mean it won’t complicate things down the line? I feel a bit lost here.
I mean, I thought NoSQL could help avoid the rigid structure of SQL, but maybe I’m not seeing the whole picture.
That’s the thing! I worry that without a solid structure, things could get chaotic, and I’m unsure if that’s wise.
Right! But then again, SQL feels like it could limit our creativity. I just don’t know which path to take!
I get it! It’s confusing. Should we maybe brainstorm how we can integrate both approaches?
That sounds like a good idea! But I’m still trying to figure out how that would even work. Can we really combine them?
I think it’s worth exploring, but I’m just not sure how we would balance their strengths without losing focus.
